item.title: Void problems
item.dc:creator: @Play_N_Skillz Play N Skillz
item.description:
@Play_N_Skillz wrote:

[quote=“MMcgrady1, post:11, topic:122211”][quote author=Play N Skillz link=topic=171837.msg1588495#msg1588495 date=1184221370]
Smartdude may be right. Different sources use different keywords, hence where you get the “cannot find symbol” error.
[/quote]First off, you get that error from not having the keyword declared, what smartdude changed won’t have anything to do with different keywords.[/quote]
Yes, different sources have different keywords declared, but perform the same operation of some similar declared in other sources.

Read full topic

item.title: Void problems
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

[quote=“iraklis123, post:8, topic:122211”]make it

public void adam(){ if(playerLevel[6] >= 70) { if(playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == false) { sendMessage("You need 6 coal to make adamantite bars."); } else if(playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == true) { addItem(2361,1); sendMessage("You smelt the ores and make an adamantite bar."); deleteItem(449,getItemSlot(449),1); deleteItem(453,getItemSlot(453),6); addSkillXP((38*playerLevel[13]), 13); startAnimation(0x383); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 70) { sendMessage("You need 70 smithing to smelt adamantite bars!"); } } }[/quote]Oh my gosh, thank you, I forgot that you don’t need the adamantite ore, because you use the adamantite ore on the furnace, thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Void problems
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

[quote=“smartdude6, post:6, topic:122211”]This part

sendMessage("You need 1 adamantite ore and 6 coal to make adamantite bars."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(449, 1) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == true)) {

try changing it to

sendMessage("You need 1 adamantite ore and 6 coal to make adamantite bars."); } else } if((playerHasItemAmount(449, 1) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == true))[/quote]

the point is “else” is just sitting there and doesn’t define anything … } else }

Read full topic

item.title: Void problems
item.dc:creator: @MMcgrady1 MMcgrady1
item.description:
@MMcgrady1 wrote:

I have this as my Adamantite bar smelting void:

public void adam(){ if(playerLevel[6] >= 70) { if((playerHasItemAmount(449, 1) == false) || (playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == false)) { sendMessage("You need 1 adamantite ore and 6 coal to make adamantite bars."); } else if((playerHasItemAmount(449, 1) == true) && (playerHasItemAmount(453, 6) == true)) { addItem(2361,1); sendMessage("You smelt the ores and make an adamantite bar."); deleteItem(449,getItemSlot(449),1); deleteItem(453,getItemSlot(453),6); addSkillXP((38*playerLevel[13]), 13); startAnimation(0x383); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else if(playerLevel[6] <= 70) { sendMessage("You need 70 smithing to smelt adamantite bars!"); } } }
Whenever I use my Adamantite ore on the furnace, I get the message saying I do not have the correct ores, but I do have the correct ores.

Read full topic
